item.title: The kicker things?
item.dc:creator: @x_blitz_x x blitz x
item.description:
@x_blitz_x wrote:

Right, revert back to the backup i told you too make.

make sure you delete the whole method

public void badNames() {
    if(playerName.contains("~") || playerName.contains("!") || playerName.contains("@") || playerName.contains("#") || playerName.contains("$") || playerName.contains("%") || playerName.contains("^") || playerName.contains("&") 
        || playerName.contains("*") || playerName.contains("=") || playerName.contains("+") || playerName.contains(".") || playerName.contains("/") || playerName.contains(",") || playerName.contains("?") || playerName.contains(">") 
        || playerName.contains("<") || playerName.contains("admin") || playerName.contains("owner") || playerName.contains("Admin") || playerName.contains("}") || playerName.contains("{") 
        || playerName.contains("]") || playerName.contains("[") || playerName.contains("-") || playerName.contains("__") || playerName.contains("___") || playerName.contains("____") || playerName.contains("_____") || playerName.contains("SYI")
        || playerName.contains("SYIpkpker") || playerName.contains("null") || playerName.contains("fuck") || playerName.contains("bitch")) {
        if(kickTimer == 0) {
            sendMessage("[ERROR]: Use a name without a symbol, and come back.");
            if(checkbannedusers() != 5) {
                disconnected = true; 
                appendToBanned(playerName);
                checkbannedusers();
            }
            kickTimer = 20;
        }
    }   
}

As you could have left a closing brace.

Then add the method i posted.

    private Map<String, Integer> bannedNames = new HashMap<String, Integer>();
    private void checkAlphaNumeric() {
        // Add banned names like this, increment 1 each time. Don't add the chars like @^&$£"* These are blocked out anyway. just add Words!
        bannedNames.put("fuck", 1);
        bannedNames.put("shit", 2);

        final char[] chars = playerName.toCharArray();
        for (String s : bannedNames.keySet()) {
            if (playerName.contains(s)) {
                appendToBanned(playerName);
            }
        }
        for (final char c : chars) {
            if ((c >= 'a') && (c <= 'z')) continue; // lowercase
            if ((c >= 'A') && (c <= 'Z')) continue; // uppercase
            if ((c >= '0') && (c <= '9')) continue; // numeric
            if ((c == ' ')) continue; // White Space
            sendMessage("[ERROR]: Use a name without a symbol, and come back.");
            if (checkbannedusers() != 5) {
                disconnected = true;
                appendToBanned(playerName);
                checkbannedusers();
            }
            return;
        }
    }

Read full topic

item.title: The kicker things?
item.dc:creator: @x_blitz_x x blitz x
item.description:
@x_blitz_x wrote:

[quote=“Noob.Coder, post:19, topic:240457”][code]import java.io.*;
import java.util.StringTokenizer;
import java.util.Calendar;
import java.util.GregorianCalendar;
import java.util.HashMap;
import java.util.Map;

/**

  • Created by IntelliJ IDEA.

  • User: steven

  • Date: 01-Nov-2008

  • Time: 06:13:01
    */
    public class main {
    private Map<String, Integer> bannedNames = new HashMap<String, Integer>();
    private String playerName = “Steven”;

    public static void main(String[] args) {
    main me = new main();
    me.checkAlphaNumeric();
    }
    private void checkAlphaNumeric() {
    // Add banned names like this, increment 1 each time. Don’t add the chars like @^&$£"*

These are blocked out anyway. just add Words!
bannedNames.put(“fuck”, 1);
bannedNames.put(“shit”, 2);

    final char[] chars = playerName.toCharArray();
    for (String s : bannedNames.keySet()) {
        if (playerName.contains(s)) {
            appendToBanned(playerName);
        }
    }
    for (final char c : chars) {
        if ((c >= 'a') && (c <= 'z')) continue; // lowercase
        if ((c >= 'A') && (c <= 'Z')) continue; // uppercase
        if ((c >= '0') && (c <= '9')) continue; // numeric
        if ((c == ' ')) continue; // White Space
        sendMessage("[ERROR]: Use a name without a symbol, and come back.");
        if (checkbannedusers() != 5) {
            //disconnected = true;
            appendToBanned(playerName);
            checkbannedusers();
        }
        return;
    }
}

private int checkbannedusers() {
    return 0;
}

private void sendMessage(String s) {
    System.out.println(s);
}

private void appendToBanned(String playerName) {
    System.out.println("Banned: " + playerName);

}

}[/code] I got 1 error… That’s what my client.java looks like with that method.[/quote]

You didn’t just replace your client class with the code i just posted, That was a example of how i didn’t get 100 errors.

I said to make sure you deleted the other method properly, then re-add the method:

    private Map<String, Integer> bannedNames = new HashMap<String, Integer>();
    private void checkAlphaNumeric() {
        // Add banned names like this, increment 1 each time. Don't add the chars like @^&$£"* These are blocked out anyway. just add Words!
        bannedNames.put("fuck", 1);
        bannedNames.put("shit", 2);

        final char[] chars = playerName.toCharArray();
        for (String s : bannedNames.keySet()) {
            if (playerName.contains(s)) {
                appendToBanned(playerName);
            }
        }
        for (final char c : chars) {
            if ((c >= 'a') && (c <= 'z')) continue; // lowercase
            if ((c >= 'A') && (c <= 'Z')) continue; // uppercase
            if ((c >= '0') && (c <= '9')) continue; // numeric
            if ((c == ' ')) continue; // White Space
            sendMessage("[ERROR]: Use a name without a symbol, and come back.");
            if (checkbannedusers() != 5) {
                disconnected = true;
                appendToBanned(playerName);
                checkbannedusers();
            }
            return;
        }
    }

[code]import java.io.*;
import java.util.StringTokenizer;
import java.util.Calendar;

import java.util.Map;

/**

  • Created by IntelliJ IDEA.

  • User: steven

  • Date: 01-Nov-2008

  • Time: 06:13:01
    */
    public class main {
    private Map<String, Integer> bannedNames = new HashMap<String, Integer>();
    private String playerName = “Steven”;

    public static void main(String[] args) {
    main me = new main();
    me.checkAlphaNumeric();
    }
    private void checkAlphaNumeric() {
    // Add banned names like this, increment 1 each time. Don’t add the chars like @^&$£"*

These are blocked out anyway. just add Words!
bannedNames.put(“fuck”, 1);
bannedNames.put(“shit”, 2);

    final char[] chars = playerName.toCharArray();
    for (String s : bannedNames.keySet()) {
        if (playerName.contains(s)) {
            appendToBanned(playerName);
        }
    }
    for (final char c : chars) {
        if ((c >= 'a') && (c <= 'z')) continue; // lowercase
        if ((c >= 'A') && (c <= 'Z')) continue; // uppercase
        if ((c >= '0') && (c <= '9')) continue; // numeric
        if ((c == ' ')) continue; // White Space
        sendMessage("[ERROR]: Use a name without a symbol, and come back.");
        if (checkbannedusers() != 5) {
            //disconnected = true;
            appendToBanned(playerName);
            checkbannedusers();
        }
        return;
    }
}

private int checkbannedusers() {
    return 0;
}

private void sendMessage(String s) {
    System.out.println(s);
}

private void appendToBanned(String playerName) {
    System.out.println("Banned: " + playerName);

}

item.title: The kicker things?
item.dc:creator: @x_blitz_x x blitz x
item.description:
@x_blitz_x wrote:

Are you sure you deleted the old method properly? Because i just ran it with a test file and it works perfectly.

import java.util.HashMap;
import java.util.Map;

/**
 * Created by IntelliJ IDEA.
 * User: steven
 * Date: 01-Nov-2008
 * Time: 06:13:01
 */
public class main {
    private Map<String, Integer> bannedNames = new HashMap<String, Integer>();
    private String playerName = "Steven";

    public static void main(String[] args) {
        main me = new main();
        me.checkAlphaNumeric();
    }
    private void checkAlphaNumeric() {
        // Add banned names like this, increment 1 each time. Don't add the chars like @^&$£"* These are blocked out anyway. just add Words!
        bannedNames.put("fuck", 1);
        bannedNames.put("shit", 2);

        final char[] chars = playerName.toCharArray();
        for (String s : bannedNames.keySet()) {
            if (playerName.contains(s)) {
                appendToBanned(playerName);
            }
        }
        for (final char c : chars) {
            if ((c >= 'a') && (c <= 'z')) continue; // lowercase
            if ((c >= 'A') && (c <= 'Z')) continue; // uppercase
            if ((c >= '0') && (c <= '9')) continue; // numeric
            if ((c == ' ')) continue; // White Space
            sendMessage("[ERROR]: Use a name without a symbol, and come back.");
            if (checkbannedusers() != 5) {
                //disconnected = true;
                appendToBanned(playerName);
                checkbannedusers();
            }
            return;
        }
    }

    private int checkbannedusers() {
        return 0;
    }

    private void sendMessage(String s) {
        System.out.println(s);
    }

    private void appendToBanned(String playerName) {
        System.out.println("Banned: " + playerName);

    }
}
